question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
Complete the statement of the Intermediate Value Theorem by filling in
the blanks: Suppose the function $f$ is continuous on the interval
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ and $L$ is a number between $f(a)$ and $f(b)$.
Then there is at least one number \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ in $[a,b]$
satisfying $f(c) = L$.
sols:
Suppose the function $f$ is continuous on the interval {[}a,b{]} and $L$
is a number between $f(a)$ and $f(b)$. Then there is at least one number
c in $[a,b]$ satisfying $f(c) = L$.
hints:
Which letters appear in the conclusion of the theorem? Where do they
belong in the opening statement of the theorem?
